page.title: 12Religion Mount Bures Church
page.content: On Friday 7th June l985 my group, another group and I went to Mount Bures Church. There was a lady there who told us a lot about the church. She told us that it was dedicated to Saint John the Baptist. It is a small church and was built somewhere between l066 and lll9 by Roger of Pitou. She thought that Roger dedicated the church to Saint John in memory of his mother, who had been beheaded by robbers. There are three windows left in the church which were built by the Normans. These are small and round headed. The one in the south wall has now been blocked. At one time the church contained part of an old wall painting, the picture of which hangs in the church, as well as what is possibly the oldest grave stone in Essex.
